00332 QCPGraph::QCPGraph(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis) :
00333   QCPAbstractPlottable(keyAxis, valueAxis)
00334 {
00335   mData = new QCPDataMap;
00336   
00337   setPen(QPen(Qt::blue));
00338   setErrorPen(QPen(Qt::black));
00339   setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
00340   setSelectedPen(QPen(QColor(80, 80, 255), 2.5));
00341   setSelectedBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
00342   
00343   setLineStyle(lsLine);
00344   setScatterStyle(QCP::ssNone);
00345   setScatterSize(6);
00346   setErrorType(etNone);
00347   setErrorBarSize(6);
00348   setErrorBarSkipSymbol(true);
00349   setChannelFillGraph(0);
00350 }
00351 
00352 QCPGraph::~QCPGraph()
00353 {
00354   if (mParentPlot)
00355   {
00356     // if another graph has a channel fill towards this graph, set it to zero
00357     for (int i=0; i<mParentPlot->graphCount(); ++i)
00358     {
00359       if (mParentPlot->graph(i)->channelFillGraph() == this)
00360         mParentPlot->graph(i)->setChannelFillGraph(0);
00361     }
00362   }
00363   delete mData;
00364 }
00365 
00373 void QCPGraph::setData(QCPDataMap *data, bool copy)
00374 {
00375   if (copy)
00376   {
00377     *mData = *data;
00378   } else
00379   {
00380     delete mData;
00381     mData = data;
00382   }
00383 }
00384 
00391 void QCPGraph::setData(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value)
00392 {
00393   mData->clear();
00394   int n = key.size();
00395   n = qMin(n, value.size());
00396   QCPData newData;
00397   for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
00398   {
00399     newData.key = key[i];
00400     newData.value = value[i];
00401     mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
00402   }
00403 }
00404 
00414 void QCPGraph::setDataValueError(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value, const QVector<double> &valueError)
00415 {
00416   mData->clear();
00417   int n = key.size();
00418   n = qMin(n, value.size());
00419   n = qMin(n, valueError.size());
00420   QCPData newData;
00421   for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
00422   {
00423     newData.key = key[i];
00424     newData.value = value[i];
00425     newData.valueErrorMinus = valueError[i];
00426     newData.valueErrorPlus = valueError[i];
00427     mData->insertMulti(key[i], newData);
00428   }
00429 }
00430 
00440 void QCPGraph::setDataValueError(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value, const QVector<double> &valueErrorMinus, const QVector<double> &valueErrorPlus)
00441 {
00442   mData->clear();
00443   int n = key.size();
00444   n = qMin(n, value.size());
00445   n = qMin(n, valueErrorMinus.size());
00446   n = qMin(n, valueErrorPlus.size());
00447   QCPData newData;
00448   for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
00449   {
00450     newData.key = key[i];
00451     newData.value = value[i];
00452     newData.valueErrorMinus = valueErrorMinus[i];
00453     newData.valueErrorPlus = valueErrorPlus[i];
00454     mData->insertMulti(key[i], newData);
00455   }
00456 }

00467 void QCPGraph::setDataKeyError(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value, const QVector<double> &keyError)
00468 {
00469   mData->clear();
00470   int n = key.size();
00471   n = qMin(n, value.size());
00472   n = qMin(n, keyError.size());
00473   QCPData newData;
00474   for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
00475   {
00476     newData.key = key[i];
00477     newData.value = value[i];
00478     newData.keyErrorMinus = keyError[i];
00479     newData.keyErrorPlus = keyError[i];
00480     mData->insertMulti(key[i], newData);
00481   }
00482 }

00493 void QCPGraph::setDataKeyError(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value, const QVector<double> &keyErrorMinus, const QVector<double> &keyErrorPlus)
00494 {
00495   mData->clear();
00496   int n = key.size();
00497   n = qMin(n, value.size());
00498   n = qMin(n, keyErrorMinus.size());
00499   n = qMin(n, keyErrorPlus.size());
00500   QCPData newData;
00501   for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
00502   {
00503     newData.key = key[i];
00504     newData.value = value[i];
00505     newData.keyErrorMinus = keyErrorMinus[i];
00506     newData.keyErrorPlus = keyErrorPlus[i];
00507     mData->insertMulti(key[i], newData);
00508   }
00509 }
00510 
00520 void QCPGraph::setDataBothError(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value, const QVector<double> &keyError, const QVector<double> &valueError)
00521 {
00522   mData->clear();
00523   int n = key.size();
00524   n = qMin(n, value.size());
00525   n = qMin(n, valueError.size());
00526   n = qMin(n, keyError.size());
00527   QCPData newData;
00528   for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
00529   {
00530     newData.key = key[i];
00531     newData.value = value[i];
00532     newData.keyErrorMinus = keyError[i];
00533     newData.keyErrorPlus = keyError[i];
00534     newData.valueErrorMinus = valueError[i];
00535     newData.valueErrorPlus = valueError[i];
00536     mData->insertMulti(key[i], newData);
00537   }
00538 }
00539 
00549 void QCPGraph::setDataBothError(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value, const QVector<double> &keyErrorMinus, const QVector<double> &keyErrorPlus, const QVector<double> &valueErrorMinus, const QVector<double> &valueErrorPlus)
00550 {
00551   mData->clear();
00552   int n = key.size();
00553   n = qMin(n, value.size());
00554   n = qMin(n, valueErrorMinus.size());
00555   n = qMin(n, valueErrorPlus.size());
00556   n = qMin(n, keyErrorMinus.size());
00557   n = qMin(n, keyErrorPlus.size());
00558   QCPData newData;
00559   for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
00560   {
00561     newData.key = key[i];
00562     newData.value = value[i];
00563     newData.keyErrorMinus = keyErrorMinus[i];
00564     newData.keyErrorPlus = keyErrorPlus[i];
00565     newData.valueErrorMinus = valueErrorMinus[i];
00566     newData.valueErrorPlus = valueErrorPlus[i];
00567     mData->insertMulti(key[i], newData);
00568   }
00569 }

00661 
00671 void QCPGraph::setChannelFillGraph(QCPGraph *targetGraph)
00672 {
00673   // prevent setting channel target to this graph itself:
00674   if (targetGraph == this)
00675   {
00676     qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "targetGraph is this graph itself";
00677     mChannelFillGraph = 0;
00678     return;
00679   }
00680   // prevent setting channel target to a graph not in the plot:
00681   if (targetGraph && targetGraph->mParentPlot != mParentPlot)
00682   {
00683     qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "targetGraph not in same plot";
00684     mChannelFillGraph = 0;
00685     return;
00686   }
00687   
00688   mChannelFillGraph = targetGraph;
00689 }
00690 
00695 void QCPGraph::addData(const QCPDataMap &dataMap)
00696 {
00697   mData->unite(dataMap);
00698 }
00699 
00704 void QCPGraph::addData(const QCPData &data)
00705 {
00706   mData->insertMulti(data.key, data);
00707 }

00713 void QCPGraph::addData(double key, double value)
00714 {
00715   QCPData newData;
00716   newData.key = key;
00717   newData.value = value;
00718   mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
00719 }
00720 
00725 void QCPGraph::addData(const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &values)
00726 {
00727   int n = qMin(keys.size(), values.size());
00728   QCPData newData;
00729   for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
00730   {
00731     newData.key = keys[i];
00732     newData.value = values[i];
00733     mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
00734   }
00735 }
00736 
00741 void QCPGraph::removeDataBefore(double key)
00742 {
00743   QCPDataMap::iterator it = mData->begin();
00744   while (it != mData->end() && it.key() < key)
00745     it = mData->erase(it);
00746 }
00747 
00752 void QCPGraph::removeDataAfter(double key)
00753 {
00754   if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
00755   QCPDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(key);
00756   while (it != mData->end())
00757     it = mData->erase(it);
00758 }
00759 
00767 void QCPGraph::removeData(double fromKey, double toKey)
00768 {
00769   if (fromKey >= toKey || mData->isEmpty()) return;
00770   QCPDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(fromKey);
00771   QCPDataMap::iterator itEnd = mData->upperBound(toKey);
00772   while (it != itEnd)
00773     it = mData->erase(it);
00774 }
00775 
00784 void QCPGraph::removeData(double key)
00785 {
00786   mData->remove(key);
00787 }
00788 
00793 void QCPGraph::clearData()
00794 {
00795   mData->clear();
00796 }
00797 
00798 /* inherits documentation from base class */
00799 double QCPGraph::selectTest(const QPointF &pos) const
00800 {
00801   if (mData->isEmpty() || !mVisible)
00802     return -1;
00803   
00804   return pointDistance(pos);
00805 }
00806 
00812 void QCPGraph::rescaleAxes(bool onlyEnlarge, bool includeErrorBars) const
00813 {
00814   rescaleKeyAxis(onlyEnlarge, includeErrorBars);
00815   rescaleValueAxis(onlyEnlarge, includeErrorBars);
00816 }
00817 
00823 void QCPGraph::rescaleKeyAxis(bool onlyEnlarge, bool includeErrorBars) const
00824 {
00825   // this code is a copy of QCPAbstractPlottable::rescaleKeyAxis with the only change
00826   // that getKeyRange is passed the includeErrorBars value.
00827   if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
00828 
00829   SignDomain signDomain = sdBoth;
00830   if (mKeyAxis->scaleType() == QCPAxis::stLogarithmic)
00831     signDomain = (mKeyAxis->range().upper < 0 ? sdNegative : sdPositive);
00832   
00833   bool validRange;
00834   QCPRange newRange = getKeyRange(validRange, signDomain, includeErrorBars);
00835   
00836   if (validRange)
00837   {
00838     if (onlyEnlarge)
00839     {
00840       if (mKeyAxis->range().lower < newRange.lower)
00841         newRange.lower = mKeyAxis->range().lower;
00842       if (mKeyAxis->range().upper > newRange.upper)
00843         newRange.upper = mKeyAxis->range().upper;
00844     }
00845     mKeyAxis->setRange(newRange);
00846   }
00847 }
00848 
00854 void QCPGraph::rescaleValueAxis(bool onlyEnlarge, bool includeErrorBars) const
00855 {
00856   // this code is a copy of QCPAbstractPlottable::rescaleValueAxis with the only change
00857   // is that getValueRange is passed the includeErrorBars value.
00858   if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
00859 
00860   SignDomain signDomain = sdBoth;
00861   if (mValueAxis->scaleType() == QCPAxis::stLogarithmic)
00862     signDomain = (mValueAxis->range().upper < 0 ? sdNegative : sdPositive);
00863   
00864   bool validRange;
00865   QCPRange newRange = getValueRange(validRange, signDomain, includeErrorBars);
00866   
00867   if (validRange)
00868   {
00869     if (onlyEnlarge)
00870     {
00871       if (mValueAxis->range().lower < newRange.lower)
00872         newRange.lower = mValueAxis->range().lower;
00873       if (mValueAxis->range().upper > newRange.upper)
00874         newRange.upper = mValueAxis->range().upper;
00875     }
00876     mValueAxis->setRange(newRange);
00877   }
00878 }
00879 
00880 /* inherits documentation from base class */
00881 void QCPGraph::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
00882 {
00883   if (mKeyAxis->range().size() <= 0 || mData->isEmpty()) return;
00884   if (mLineStyle == lsNone && mScatterStyle == QCP::ssNone) return;
00885   
00886   // allocate line and (if necessary) point vectors:
00887   QVector<QPointF> *lineData = new QVector<QPointF>;
00888   QVector<QCPData> *pointData = 0;
00889   if (mScatterStyle != QCP::ssNone)
00890     pointData = new QVector<QCPData>;
00891   
00892   // fill vectors with data appropriate to plot style:
00893   getPlotData(lineData, pointData);
00894 
00895   // draw fill of graph:
00896   drawFill(painter, lineData);
00897   
00898   // draw line:
00899   if (mLineStyle == lsImpulse)
00900     drawImpulsePlot(painter, lineData);
00901   else if (mLineStyle != lsNone)
00902     drawLinePlot(painter, lineData); // also step plots can be drawn as a line plot
00903   
00904   // draw scatters:
00905   if (pointData)
00906     drawScatterPlot(painter, pointData);
00907   
00908   // free allocated line and point vectors:
00909   delete lineData;
00910   if (pointData)
00911     delete pointData;
00912 }
00913 
00914 /* inherits documentation from base class */
00915 void QCPGraph::drawLegendIcon(QCPPainter *painter, const QRect &rect) const
00916 {
00917   // draw fill:
00918   if (mBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush)
00919   {
00920     applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
00921     painter->fillRect(QRectF(rect.left(), rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0, rect.width(), rect.height()/3.0), mBrush);
00922   }
00923   // draw line vertically centered:
00924   if (mLineStyle != lsNone)
00925   {
00926     applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
00927     painter->setPen(mPen);
00928     painter->drawLine(QLineF(rect.left(), rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0, rect.right()+5, rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0)); // +5 on x2 else last segment is missing from dashed/dotted pens
00929   }
00930   // draw scatter symbol:
00931   if (mScatterStyle != QCP::ssNone)
00932   {
00933     if (mScatterStyle == QCP::ssPixmap && (mScatterPixmap.size().width() > rect.width() || mScatterPixmap.size().height() > rect.height()))
00934     {
00935       // handle pixmap scatters that are larger than legend icon rect separately.
00936       // We resize them and draw them manually, instead of calling drawScatter:
00937       QSize newSize = mScatterPixmap.size();
00938       newSize.scale(rect.size(), Qt::KeepAspectRatio);
00939       QRect targetRect;
00940       targetRect.setSize(newSize);
00941       targetRect.moveCenter(rect.center());
00942       bool smoothBackup = painter->testRenderHint(QPainter::SmoothPixmapTransform);
00943       painter->setRenderHint(QPainter::SmoothPixmapTransform, true);
00944       painter->drawPixmap(targetRect, mScatterPixmap);
00945       painter->setRenderHint(QPainter::SmoothPixmapTransform, smoothBackup);
00946     } else
00947     {
00948       applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
00949       painter->setPen(mPen);
00950       painter->drawScatter(QRectF(rect).center().x(), QRectF(rect).center().y(), mScatterSize, mScatterStyle);
00951     }
00952   }
00953 }
00954 
00967 void QCPGraph::getPlotData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
00968 {
00969   switch(mLineStyle)
00970   {
00971     case lsNone: getScatterPlotData(pointData); break;
00972     case lsLine: getLinePlotData(lineData, pointData); break;
00973     case lsStepLeft: getStepLeftPlotData(lineData, pointData); break;
00974     case lsStepRight: getStepRightPlotData(lineData, pointData); break;
00975     case lsStepCenter: getStepCenterPlotData(lineData, pointData); break;
00976     case lsImpulse: getImpulsePlotData(lineData, pointData); break;
00977   }
00978 }
00979 
00990 void QCPGraph::getScatterPlotData(QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
00991 {
00992   if (!pointData) return;
00993   
00994   // get visible data range:
00995   QCPDataMap::const_iterator lower, upper;
00996   int dataCount;
00997   getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upper, dataCount);
00998   // prepare vectors:
00999   if (pointData)
01000     pointData->resize(dataCount);
01001 
01002   // position data points:
01003   QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
01004   QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper+1;
01005   int i = 0;
01006   if (mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
01007   {
01008     while (it != upperEnd)
01009     {
01010       (*pointData)[i] = it.value();
01011       ++i;
01012       ++it;
01013     }
01014   } else // key axis is horizontal
01015   {
01016     while (it != upperEnd)
01017     {
01018       (*pointData)[i] = it.value();
01019       ++i;
01020       ++it;
01021     }
01022   }
01023 }
01024 
01035 void QCPGraph::getLinePlotData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
01036 {
01037   // get visible data range:
01038   QCPDataMap::const_iterator lower, upper;
01039   int dataCount;
01040   getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upper, dataCount);
01041   // prepare vectors:
01042   if (lineData)
01043   { 
01044     // added 2 to reserve memory for lower/upper fill base points that might be needed for fill
01045     lineData->reserve(dataCount+2);
01046     lineData->resize(dataCount);
01047   }
01048   if (pointData)
01049     pointData->resize(dataCount);
01050 
01051   // position data points:
01052   QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
01053   QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper+1;
01054   int i = 0;
01055   if (mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
01056   {
01057     while (it != upperEnd)
01058     {
01059       if (pointData)
01060         (*pointData)[i] = it.value();
01061       (*lineData)[i].setX(mValueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value));
01062       (*lineData)[i].setY(mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key()));
01063       ++i;
01064       ++it;
01065     }
01066   } else // key axis is horizontal
01067   {
01068     while (it != upperEnd)
01069     {
01070       if (pointData)
01071         (*pointData)[i] = it.value();
01072       (*lineData)[i].setX(mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key()));
01073       (*lineData)[i].setY(mValueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value));
01074       ++i;
01075       ++it;
01076     }
01077   }
01078 }
01079 
01090 void QCPGraph::getStepLeftPlotData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
01091 {
01092   // get visible data range:
01093   QCPDataMap::const_iterator lower, upper;
01094   int dataCount;
01095   getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upper, dataCount);
01096   // prepare vectors:
01097   if (lineData)
01098   {
01099     // added 2 to reserve memory for lower/upper fill base points that might be needed for fill
01100     // multiplied by 2 because step plot needs two polyline points per one actual data point
01101     lineData->reserve(dataCount*2+2);
01102     lineData->resize(dataCount*2);
01103   }
01104   if (pointData)
01105     pointData->resize(dataCount);
01106   
01107   // position data points:
01108   QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
01109   QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper+1;
01110   int i = 0;
01111   int ipoint = 0;
01112   if (mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
01113   {
01114     double lastValue = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
01115     double key;
01116     while (it != upperEnd)
01117     {
01118       if (pointData)
01119       {
01120         (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
01121         ++ipoint;
01122       }
01123       key = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
01124       (*lineData)[i].setX(lastValue);
01125       (*lineData)[i].setY(key);
01126       ++i;
01127       lastValue = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
01128       (*lineData)[i].setX(lastValue);
01129       (*lineData)[i].setY(key);
01130       ++i;
01131       ++it;
01132     }
01133   } else // key axis is horizontal
01134   {
01135     double lastValue = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
01136     double key;
01137     while (it != upperEnd)
01138     {
01139       if (pointData)
01140       {
01141         (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
01142         ++ipoint;
01143       }
01144       key = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
01145       (*lineData)[i].setX(key);
01146       (*lineData)[i].setY(lastValue);
01147       ++i;
01148       lastValue = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
01149       (*lineData)[i].setX(key);
01150       (*lineData)[i].setY(lastValue);
01151       ++i;
01152       ++it;
01153     }
01154   }
01155 }
01156 
01167 void QCPGraph::getStepRightPlotData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
01168 {
01169   // get visible data range:
01170   QCPDataMap::const_iterator lower, upper;
01171   int dataCount;
01172   getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upper, dataCount);
01173   // prepare vectors:
01174   if (lineData)
01175   {
01176     // added 2 to reserve memory for lower/upper fill base points that might be needed for fill
01177     // multiplied by 2 because step plot needs two polyline points per one actual data point
01178     lineData->reserve(dataCount*2+2);
01179     lineData->resize(dataCount*2);
01180   }
01181   if (pointData)
01182     pointData->resize(dataCount);
01183   
01184   // position points:
01185   QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
01186   QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper+1;
01187   int i = 0;
01188   int ipoint = 0;
01189   if (mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
01190   {
01191     double lastKey = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
01192     double value;
01193     while (it != upperEnd)
01194     {
01195       if (pointData)
01196       {
01197         (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
01198         ++ipoint;
01199       }
01200       value = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
01201       (*lineData)[i].setX(value);
01202       (*lineData)[i].setY(lastKey);
01203       ++i;
01204       lastKey = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
01205       (*lineData)[i].setX(value);
01206       (*lineData)[i].setY(lastKey);
01207       ++i;
01208       ++it;
01209     }
01210   } else // key axis is horizontal
01211   {
01212     double lastKey = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
01213     double value;
01214     while (it != upperEnd)
01215     {
01216       if (pointData)
01217       {
01218         (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
01219         ++ipoint;
01220       }
01221       value = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
01222       (*lineData)[i].setX(lastKey);
01223       (*lineData)[i].setY(value);
01224       ++i;
01225       lastKey = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
01226       (*lineData)[i].setX(lastKey);
01227       (*lineData)[i].setY(value);
01228       ++i;
01229       ++it;
01230     }
01231   }
01232 }
01233 
01244 void QCPGraph::getStepCenterPlotData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
01245 {
01246   // get visible data range:
01247   QCPDataMap::const_iterator lower, upper;
01248   int dataCount;
01249   getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upper, dataCount);
01250   // prepare vectors:
01251   if (lineData)
01252   {
01253     // added 2 to reserve memory for lower/upper fill base points that might be needed for base fill
01254     // multiplied by 2 because step plot needs two polyline points per one actual data point
01255     lineData->reserve(dataCount*2+2);
01256     lineData->resize(dataCount*2);
01257   }
01258   if (pointData)
01259     pointData->resize(dataCount);
01260   
01261   // position points:
01262   QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
01263   QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper+1;
01264   int i = 0;
01265   int ipoint = 0;
01266   if (mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
01267   {
01268     double lastKey = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
01269     double lastValue = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
01270     double key;
01271     if (pointData)
01272     {
01273       (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
01274       ++ipoint;
01275     }
01276     (*lineData)[i].setX(lastValue);
01277     (*lineData)[i].setY(lastKey);
01278     ++it;
01279     ++i;
01280     while (it != upperEnd)
01281     {
01282       if (pointData)
01283       {
01284         (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
01285         ++ipoint;
01286       }
01287       key = (mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key())-lastKey)*0.5 + lastKey;
01288       (*lineData)[i].setX(lastValue);
01289       (*lineData)[i].setY(key);
01290       ++i;
01291       lastValue = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
01292       lastKey = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
01293       (*lineData)[i].setX(lastValue);
01294       (*lineData)[i].setY(key);
01295       ++it;
01296       ++i;
01297     }
01298     (*lineData)[i].setX(lastValue);
01299     (*lineData)[i].setY(lastKey);
01300   } else // key axis is horizontal
01301   {
01302     double lastKey = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
01303     double lastValue = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
01304     double key;
01305     if (pointData)
01306     {
01307       (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
01308       ++ipoint;
01309     }
01310     (*lineData)[i].setX(lastKey);
01311     (*lineData)[i].setY(lastValue);
01312     ++it;
01313     ++i;
01314     while (it != upperEnd)
01315     {
01316       if (pointData)
01317       {
01318         (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
01319         ++ipoint;
01320       }
01321       key = (mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key())-lastKey)*0.5 + lastKey;
01322       (*lineData)[i].setX(key);
01323       (*lineData)[i].setY(lastValue);
01324       ++i;
01325       lastValue = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
01326       lastKey = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
01327       (*lineData)[i].setX(key);
01328       (*lineData)[i].setY(lastValue);
01329       ++it;
01330       ++i;
01331     }
01332     (*lineData)[i].setX(lastKey);
01333     (*lineData)[i].setY(lastValue);
01334   }
01335 }
01336 
01347 void QCPGraph::getImpulsePlotData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
01348 {
01349   // get visible data range:
01350   QCPDataMap::const_iterator lower, upper;
01351   int dataCount;
01352   getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upper, dataCount);
01353   // prepare vectors:
01354   if (lineData)
01355   {
01356     // no need to reserve 2 extra points, because there is no fill for impulse plot
01357     lineData->resize(dataCount*2);
01358   }
01359   if (pointData)
01360     pointData->resize(dataCount);
01361   
01362   // position data points:
01363   QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
01364   QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper+1;
01365   int i = 0;
01366   int ipoint = 0;
01367   if (mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
01368   {
01369     double zeroPointX = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(0);
01370     double key;
01371     while (it != upperEnd)
01372     {
01373       if (pointData)
01374       {
01375         (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
01376         ++ipoint;
01377       }
01378       key = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
01379       (*lineData)[i].setX(zeroPointX);
01380       (*lineData)[i].setY(key);
01381       ++i;
01382       (*lineData)[i].setX(mValueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value));
01383       (*lineData)[i].setY(key);
01384       ++i;
01385       ++it;
01386     }
01387   } else // key axis is horizontal
01388   {
01389     double zeroPointY = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(0);
01390     double key;
01391     while (it != upperEnd)
01392     {
01393       if (pointData)
01394       {
01395         (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
01396         ++ipoint;
01397       }
01398       key = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
01399       (*lineData)[i].setX(key);
01400       (*lineData)[i].setY(zeroPointY);
01401       ++i;
01402       (*lineData)[i].setX(key);
01403       (*lineData)[i].setY(mValueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value));
01404       ++i;
01405       ++it;
01406     }
01407   }
01408 }
01409 
01421 void QCPGraph::drawFill(QCPPainter *painter, QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
01422 {
01423   if (mLineStyle == lsImpulse) return; // fill doesn't make sense for impulse plot
01424   if (mainBrush().style() == Qt::NoBrush || mainBrush().color().alpha() == 0) return;
01425   
01426   applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
01427   if (!mChannelFillGraph)
01428   {
01429     // draw base fill under graph, fill goes all the way to the zero-value-line:
01430     addFillBasePoints(lineData);
01431     painter->setPen(Qt::NoPen);
01432     painter->setBrush(mainBrush());
01433     painter->drawPolygon(QPolygonF(*lineData));
01434     removeFillBasePoints(lineData);
01435   } else
01436   {
01437     // draw channel fill between this graph and mChannelFillGraph:
01438     painter->setPen(Qt::NoPen);
01439     painter->setBrush(mainBrush());
01440     painter->drawPolygon(getChannelFillPolygon(lineData));
01441   }
01442 }
01443 
01451 void QCPGraph::drawScatterPlot(QCPPainter *painter, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
01452 {
01453   // draw error bars:
01454   if (mErrorType != etNone)
01455   {
01456     applyErrorBarsAntialiasingHint(painter);
01457     painter->setPen(mErrorPen);
01458     if (mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
01459     {
01460       for (int i=0; i<pointData->size(); ++i)
01461         drawError(painter, mValueAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).value), mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).key), pointData->at(i));
01462     } else
01463     {
01464       for (int i=0; i<pointData->size(); ++i)
01465         drawError(painter, mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).key), mValueAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).value), pointData->at(i));
01466     }
01467   }
01468   
01469   // draw scatter point symbols:
01470   applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
01471   painter->setPen(mainPen());
01472   painter->setBrush(mainBrush());
01473   painter->setScatterPixmap(mScatterPixmap);
01474   if (mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
01475   {
01476     for (int i=0; i<pointData->size(); ++i)
01477       painter->drawScatter(mValueAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).value), mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).key), mScatterSize, mScatterStyle);
01478   } else
01479   {
01480     for (int i=0; i<pointData->size(); ++i)
01481       painter->drawScatter(mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).key), mValueAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).value), mScatterSize, mScatterStyle);
01482   }
01483 }
01484 
01493 void QCPGraph::drawLinePlot(QCPPainter *painter, QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
01494 {
01495   // draw line of graph:
01496   if (mainPen().style() != Qt::NoPen && mainPen().color().alpha() != 0)
01497   {
01498     applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
01499     painter->setPen(mainPen());
01500     painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
01501     
01502     /* Draws polyline in batches, currently not used:
01503     int p = 0;
01504     while (p < lineData->size())
01505     {
01506       int batch = qMin(25, lineData->size()-p);
01507       if (p != 0)
01508       {
01509         ++batch;
01510         --p; // to draw the connection lines between two batches
01511       }
01512       painter->drawPolyline(lineData->constData()+p, batch);
01513       p += batch;
01514     }
01515     */
01516     
01517     // if drawing solid line and not in PDF, use much faster line drawing instead of polyline:
01518     if (mParentPlot->plottingHints().testFlag(QCP::phFastPolylines) &&
01519         painter->pen().style() == Qt::SolidLine &&
01520         !painter->pdfExportMode())
01521     {
01522       for (int i=1; i<lineData->size(); ++i)
01523         painter->drawLine(lineData->at(i-1), lineData->at(i));
01524     } else
01525     {  
01526       painter->drawPolyline(QPolygonF(*lineData));
01527     }
01528   }
01529 }
01530 
01537 void QCPGraph::drawImpulsePlot(QCPPainter *painter, QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
01538 {
01539   // draw impulses:
01540   if (mainPen().style() != Qt::NoPen && mainPen().color().alpha() != 0)
01541   {
01542     applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
01543     QPen pen = mainPen();
01544     pen.setCapStyle(Qt::FlatCap); // so impulse line doesn't reach beyond zero-line
01545     painter->setPen(pen);
01546     painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
01547     painter->drawLines(*lineData);
01548   }
01549 }
01550 
01558 void QCPGraph::drawError(QCPPainter *painter, double x, double y, const QCPData &data) const
01559 {
01560   double a, b; // positions of error bar bounds in pixels
01561   double barWidthHalf = mErrorBarSize*0.5;
01562   double skipSymbolMargin = mScatterSize*1.25; // pixels left blank per side, when mErrorBarSkipSymbol is true
01563 
01564   if (mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
01565   {
01566     // draw key error vertically and value error horizontally
01567     if (mErrorType == etKey || mErrorType == etBoth)
01568     {
01569       a = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(data.key-data.keyErrorMinus);
01570       b = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(data.key+data.keyErrorPlus);
01571       if (mKeyAxis->rangeReversed())
01572         qSwap(a,b);
01573       // draw spine:
01574       if (mErrorBarSkipSymbol)
01575       {
01576         if (a-y > skipSymbolMargin) // don't draw spine if error is so small it's within skipSymbolmargin
01577           painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, a, x, y+skipSymbolMargin));
01578         if (y-b > skipSymbolMargin) 
01579           painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, y-skipSymbolMargin, x, b));
01580       } else
01581         painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, a, x, b));
01582       // draw handles:
01583       painter->drawLine(QLineF(x-barWidthHalf, a, x+barWidthHalf, a));
01584       painter->drawLine(QLineF(x-barWidthHalf, b, x+barWidthHalf, b));
01585     }
01586     if (mErrorType == etValue || mErrorType == etBoth)
01587     {
01588       a = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(data.value-data.valueErrorMinus);
01589       b = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(data.value+data.valueErrorPlus);
01590       if (mValueAxis->rangeReversed())
01591         qSwap(a,b);
01592       // draw spine:
01593       if (mErrorBarSkipSymbol)
01594       {
01595         if (x-a > skipSymbolMargin) // don't draw spine if error is so small it's within skipSymbolmargin
01596           painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y, x-skipSymbolMargin, y));
01597         if (b-x > skipSymbolMargin)
01598           painter->drawLine(QLineF(x+skipSymbolMargin, y, b, y));
01599       } else
01600         painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y, b, y));
01601       // draw handles:
01602       painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y-barWidthHalf, a, y+barWidthHalf));
01603       painter->drawLine(QLineF(b, y-barWidthHalf, b, y+barWidthHalf));
01604     }
01605   } else // mKeyAxis->orientation() is Qt::Horizontal
01606   {
01607     // draw value error vertically and key error horizontally
01608     if (mErrorType == etKey || mErrorType == etBoth)
01609     {
01610       a = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(data.key-data.keyErrorMinus);
01611       b = mKeyAxis->coordToPixel(data.key+data.keyErrorPlus);
01612       if (mKeyAxis->rangeReversed())
01613         qSwap(a,b);
01614       // draw spine:
01615       if (mErrorBarSkipSymbol)
01616       {
01617         if (x-a > skipSymbolMargin) // don't draw spine if error is so small it's within skipSymbolmargin
01618           painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y, x-skipSymbolMargin, y));
01619         if (b-x > skipSymbolMargin)
01620           painter->drawLine(QLineF(x+skipSymbolMargin, y, b, y));
01621       } else
01622         painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y, b, y));
01623       // draw handles:
01624       painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y-barWidthHalf, a, y+barWidthHalf));
01625       painter->drawLine(QLineF(b, y-barWidthHalf, b, y+barWidthHalf));
01626     }
01627     if (mErrorType == etValue || mErrorType == etBoth)
01628     {
01629       a = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(data.value-data.valueErrorMinus);
01630       b = mValueAxis->coordToPixel(data.value+data.valueErrorPlus);
01631       if (mValueAxis->rangeReversed())
01632         qSwap(a,b);
01633       // draw spine:
01634       if (mErrorBarSkipSymbol)
01635       {
01636         if (a-y > skipSymbolMargin) // don't draw spine if error is so small it's within skipSymbolmargin
01637           painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, a, x, y+skipSymbolMargin));
01638         if (y-b > skipSymbolMargin)
01639           painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, y-skipSymbolMargin, x, b));
01640       } else
01641         painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, a, x, b));
01642       // draw handles:
01643       painter->drawLine(QLineF(x-barWidthHalf, a, x+barWidthHalf, a));
01644       painter->drawLine(QLineF(x-barWidthHalf, b, x+barWidthHalf, b));
01645     }
01646   }
01647 }
01648 
01662 void QCPGraph::getVisibleDataBounds(QCPDataMap::const_iterator &lower, QCPDataMap::const_iterator &upper, int &count) const
01663 {
01664   // get visible data range as QMap iterators
01665   QCPDataMap::const_iterator lbound = mData->lowerBound(mKeyAxis->range().lower);
01666   QCPDataMap::const_iterator ubound = mData->upperBound(mKeyAxis->range().upper)-1;
01667   bool lowoutlier = lbound != mData->constBegin(); // indicates whether there exist points below axis range
01668   bool highoutlier = ubound+1 != mData->constEnd(); // indicates whether there exist points above axis range
01669   lower = (lowoutlier ? lbound-1 : lbound); // data pointrange that will be actually drawn
01670   upper = (highoutlier ? ubound+1 : ubound); // data pointrange that will be actually drawn
01671   
01672   // count number of points in range lower to upper (including them), so we can allocate array for them in draw functions:
01673   QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
01674   count = 1;
01675   while (it != upper)
01676   {
01677     ++it;
01678     ++count;
01679   }
01680 }
01681 
01696 void QCPGraph::addFillBasePoints(QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
01697 {
01698   // append points that close the polygon fill at the key axis:
01699   if (mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
01700   {
01701     *lineData << upperFillBasePoint(lineData->last().y());
01702     *lineData << lowerFillBasePoint(lineData->first().y());
01703   } else
01704   {
01705     *lineData << upperFillBasePoint(lineData->last().x());
01706     *lineData << lowerFillBasePoint(lineData->first().x());
01707   }
01708 }
01709 
01715 void QCPGraph::removeFillBasePoints(QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
01716 {
01717   lineData->remove(lineData->size()-2, 2);
01718 }
01719 
01733 QPointF QCPGraph::lowerFillBasePoint(double lowerKey) const
01734 {
01735   QPointF point;
01736   if (mValueAxis->scaleType() == QCPAxis::stLinear)
01737   {
01738     if (mKeyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atLeft)
01739     {
01740       point.setX(mValueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
01741       point.setY(lowerKey);
01742     } else if (mKeyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atRight)
01743     {
01744       point.setX(mValueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
01745       point.setY(lowerKey);
01746     } else if (mKeyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atTop)
01747     {
01748       point.setX(lowerKey);
01749       point.setY(mValueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
01750     } else if (mKeyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atBottom)
01751     {
01752       point.setX(lowerKey);
01753       point.setY(mValueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
01754     }
01755   } else // mValueAxis->mScaleType == QCPAxis::stLogarithmic
01756   {
01757     // In logarithmic scaling we can't just draw to value zero so we just fill all the way
01758     // to the axis which is in the direction towards zero
01759     if (mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
01760     {
01761       if ((mValueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !mValueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
01762           (mValueAxis->range().upper > 0 && mValueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on opposite side of key axis
01763         point.setX(mKeyAxis->axisRect().right());
01764       else
01765         point.setX(mKeyAxis->axisRect().left());
01766       point.setY(lowerKey);
01767     } else if (mKeyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atTop || mKeyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atBottom)
01768     {
01769       point.setX(lowerKey);
01770       if ((mValueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !mValueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
01771           (mValueAxis->range().upper > 0 && mValueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on opposite side of key axis
01772         point.setY(mKeyAxis->axisRect().top());
01773       else
01774         point.setY(mKeyAxis->axisRect().bottom());
01775     }
01776   }
01777   return point;
01778 }
01779 
01793 QPointF QCPGraph::upperFillBasePoint(double upperKey) const
01794 {
01795   QPointF point;
01796   if (mValueAxis->scaleType() == QCPAxis::stLinear)
01797   {
01798     if (mKeyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atLeft)
01799     {
01800       point.setX(mValueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
01801       point.setY(upperKey);
01802     } else if (mKeyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atRight)
01803     {
01804       point.setX(mValueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
01805       point.setY(upperKey);
01806     } else if (mKeyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atTop)
01807     {
01808       point.setX(upperKey);
01809       point.setY(mValueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
01810     } else if (mKeyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atBottom)
01811     {
01812       point.setX(upperKey);
01813       point.setY(mValueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
01814     }
01815   } else // mValueAxis->mScaleType == QCPAxis::stLogarithmic
01816   {
01817     // In logarithmic scaling we can't just draw to value 0 so we just fill all the way
01818     // to the axis which is in the direction towards 0
01819     if (mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
01820     {
01821       if ((mValueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !mValueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
01822           (mValueAxis->range().upper > 0 && mValueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on opposite side of key axis
01823         point.setX(mKeyAxis->axisRect().right());
01824       else
01825         point.setX(mKeyAxis->axisRect().left());
01826       point.setY(upperKey);
01827     } else if (mKeyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atTop || mKeyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atBottom)
01828     {
01829       point.setX(upperKey);
01830       if ((mValueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !mValueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
01831           (mValueAxis->range().upper > 0 && mValueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on opposite side of key axis
01832         point.setY(mKeyAxis->axisRect().top());
01833       else
01834         point.setY(mKeyAxis->axisRect().bottom());
01835     }
01836   }
01837   return point;
01838 }
01839 
01849 const QPolygonF QCPGraph::getChannelFillPolygon(const QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
01850 {
01851   if (mChannelFillGraph->mKeyAxis->orientation() != mKeyAxis->orientation())
01852     return QPolygonF(); // don't have same axis orientation, can't fill that (Note: if keyAxis fits, valueAxis will fit too, because it's always orthogonal to keyAxis)
01853   
01854   if (lineData->isEmpty()) return QPolygonF();
01855   QVector<QPointF> otherData;
01856   mChannelFillGraph->getPlotData(&otherData, 0);
01857   if (otherData.isEmpty()) return QPolygonF();
01858   QVector<QPointF> thisData;
01859   thisData.reserve(lineData->size()+otherData.size()); // because we will join both vectors at end of this function
01860   for (int i=0; i<lineData->size(); ++i) // don't use the vector<<(vector),  it squeezes internally, which ruins the performance tuning with reserve()
01861     thisData << lineData->at(i);
01862   
01863   // pointers to be able to swap them, depending which data range needs cropping:
01864   QVector<QPointF> *staticData = &thisData;
01865   QVector<QPointF> *croppedData = &otherData;
01866   
01867   // crop both vectors to ranges in which the keys overlap (which coord is key, depends on axisType):
01868   if (mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
01869   {
01870     // x is key
01871     // if an axis range is reversed, the data point keys will be descending. Reverse them, since following algorithm assumes ascending keys:
01872     if (staticData->first().x() > staticData->last().x())
01873     {
01874       int size = staticData->size();
01875       for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
01876         qSwap((*staticData)[i], (*staticData)[size-1-i]);
01877     }
01878     if (croppedData->first().x() > croppedData->last().x())
01879     {
01880       int size = croppedData->size();
01881       for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
01882         qSwap((*croppedData)[i], (*croppedData)[size-1-i]);
01883     }
01884     // crop lower bound:
01885     if (staticData->first().x() < croppedData->first().x()) // other one must be cropped
01886       qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
01887     int lowBound = findIndexBelowX(croppedData, staticData->first().x());
01888     if (lowBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
01889     croppedData->remove(0, lowBound);
01890     // set lowest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of first static data
01891     // point via linear interpolation:
01892     if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
01893     double slope;
01894     if (croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x() != 0)
01895       slope = (croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y())/(croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x());
01896     else
01897       slope = 0;
01898     (*croppedData)[0].setY(croppedData->at(0).y()+slope*(staticData->first().x()-croppedData->at(0).x()));
01899     (*croppedData)[0].setX(staticData->first().x());
01900     
01901     // crop upper bound:
01902     if (staticData->last().x() > croppedData->last().x()) // other one must be cropped
01903       qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
01904     int highBound = findIndexAboveX(croppedData, staticData->last().x());
01905     if (highBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
01906     croppedData->remove(highBound+1, croppedData->size()-(highBound+1));
01907     // set highest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of last static data
01908     // point via linear interpolation:
01909     if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
01910     int li = croppedData->size()-1; // last index
01911     if (croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x() != 0)
01912       slope = (croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y())/(croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x());
01913     else
01914       slope = 0;
01915     (*croppedData)[li].setY(croppedData->at(li-1).y()+slope*(staticData->last().x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x()));
01916     (*croppedData)[li].setX(staticData->last().x());
01917   } else // mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical
01918   {
01919     // y is key
01920     // similar to "x is key" but switched x,y. Further, lower/upper meaning is inverted compared to x,
01921     // because in pixel coordinates, y increases from top to bottom, not bottom to top like data coordinate.
01922     // if an axis range is reversed, the data point keys will be descending. Reverse them, since following algorithm assumes ascending keys:
01923     if (staticData->first().y() < staticData->last().y())
01924     {
01925       int size = staticData->size();
01926       for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
01927         qSwap((*staticData)[i], (*staticData)[size-1-i]);
01928     }
01929     if (croppedData->first().y() < croppedData->last().y())
01930     {
01931       int size = croppedData->size();
01932       for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
01933         qSwap((*croppedData)[i], (*croppedData)[size-1-i]);
01934     }
01935     // crop lower bound:
01936     if (staticData->first().y() > croppedData->first().y()) // other one must be cropped
01937       qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
01938     int lowBound = findIndexAboveY(croppedData, staticData->first().y());
01939     if (lowBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
01940     croppedData->remove(0, lowBound);
01941     // set lowest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of first static data
01942     // point via linear interpolation:
01943     if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
01944     double slope;
01945     if (croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y() != 0) // avoid division by zero in step plots
01946       slope = (croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x())/(croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y());
01947     else
01948       slope = 0;
01949     (*croppedData)[0].setX(croppedData->at(0).x()+slope*(staticData->first().y()-croppedData->at(0).y()));
01950     (*croppedData)[0].setY(staticData->first().y());
01951     
01952     // crop upper bound:
01953     if (staticData->last().y() < croppedData->last().y()) // other one must be cropped
01954       qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
01955     int highBound = findIndexBelowY(croppedData, staticData->last().y());
01956     if (highBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
01957     croppedData->remove(highBound+1, croppedData->size()-(highBound+1));
01958     // set highest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of last static data
01959     // point via linear interpolation:
01960     if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
01961     int li = croppedData->size()-1; // last index
01962     if (croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y() != 0) // avoid division by zero in step plots
01963       slope = (croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x())/(croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y());
01964     else
01965       slope = 0;
01966     (*croppedData)[li].setX(croppedData->at(li-1).x()+slope*(staticData->last().y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y()));
01967     (*croppedData)[li].setY(staticData->last().y());
01968   }
01969   
01970   // return joined:
01971   for (int i=otherData.size()-1; i>=0; --i) // insert reversed, otherwise the polygon will be twisted
01972     thisData << otherData.at(i);
01973   return QPolygonF(thisData);
01974 }
01975 
01983 int QCPGraph::findIndexAboveX(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double x) const
01984 {
01985   for (int i=data->size()-1; i>=0; --i)
01986   {
01987     if (data->at(i).x() < x)
01988     {
01989       if (i<data->size()-1)
01990         return i+1;
01991       else
01992         return data->size()-1;
01993     }
01994   }
01995   return -1;
01996 }
01997 
02005 int QCPGraph::findIndexBelowX(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double x) const
02006 {
02007   for (int i=0; i<data->size(); ++i)
02008   {
02009     if (data->at(i).x() > x)
02010     {
02011       if (i>0)
02012         return i-1;
02013       else
02014         return 0;
02015     }
02016   }
02017   return -1;
02018 }
02019 
02027 int QCPGraph::findIndexAboveY(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double y) const
02028 {
02029   for (int i=0; i<data->size(); ++i)
02030   {
02031     if (data->at(i).y() < y)
02032     {
02033       if (i>0)
02034         return i-1;
02035       else
02036         return 0;
02037     }
02038   }
02039   return -1;
02040 }
02041 
02048 double QCPGraph::pointDistance(const QPointF &pixelPoint) const
02049 {
02050   if (mData->isEmpty())
02051   {
02052     qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "requested point distance on graph" << mName << "without data";
02053     return 500;
02054   }
02055   if (mData->size() == 1)
02056   {
02057     QPointF dataPoint = coordsToPixels(mData->constBegin().key(), mData->constBegin().value().value);
02058     return QVector2D(dataPoint-pixelPoint).length();
02059   }
02060   
02061   if (mLineStyle == lsNone && mScatterStyle == QCP::ssNone)
02062     return 500;
02063   
02064   // calculate minimum distances to graph representation:
02065   if (mLineStyle == lsNone)
02066   {
02067     // no line displayed, only calculate distance to scatter points:
02068     QVector<QCPData> *pointData = new QVector<QCPData>;
02069     getScatterPlotData(pointData);
02070     double minDistSqr = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
02071     QPointF ptA;
02072     QPointF ptB = coordsToPixels(pointData->at(0).key, pointData->at(0).value); // getScatterPlotData returns in plot coordinates, so transform to pixels
02073     for (int i=1; i<pointData->size(); ++i)
02074     {
02075       ptA = ptB;
02076       ptB = coordsToPixels(pointData->at(i).key, pointData->at(i).value);
02077       double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(ptA, ptB, pixelPoint);
02078       if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
02079         minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
02080     }
02081     delete pointData;
02082     return sqrt(minDistSqr);
02083   } else
02084   {
02085     // line displayed calculate distance to line segments:
02086     QVector<QPointF> *lineData = new QVector<QPointF>;
02087     getPlotData(lineData, 0); // unlike with getScatterPlotData we get pixel coordinates here
02088     double minDistSqr = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
02089     if (mLineStyle == lsImpulse)
02090     {
02091       // impulse plot differs from other line styles in that the lineData points are only pairwise connected:
02092       for (int i=0; i<lineData->size()-1; i+=2) // iterate pairs
02093       {
02094         double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(lineData->at(i), lineData->at(i+1), pixelPoint);
02095         if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
02096           minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
02097       }
02098     } else 
02099     {
02100       // all other line plots (line and step) connect points directly:
02101       for (int i=0; i<lineData->size()-1; ++i)
02102       {
02103         double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(lineData->at(i), lineData->at(i+1), pixelPoint);
02104         if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
02105           minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
02106       }
02107     }
02108     delete lineData;
02109     return sqrt(minDistSqr);
02110   }
02111 }
02112 
02120 int QCPGraph::findIndexBelowY(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double y) const
02121 {
02122   for (int i=data->size()-1; i>=0; --i)
02123   {
02124     if (data->at(i).y() > y)
02125     {
02126       if (i<data->size()-1)
02127         return i+1;
02128       else
02129         return data->size()-1;
02130     }
02131   }
02132   return -1;
02133 }
02134 
02135 /* inherits documentation from base class */
02136 QCPRange QCPGraph::getKeyRange(bool &validRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
02137 {
02138   // just call the specialized version which takes an additional argument whether error bars
02139   // should also be taken into consideration for range calculation. We set this to true here.
02140   return getKeyRange(validRange, inSignDomain, true);
02141 }
02142 
02143 /* inherits documentation from base class */
02144 QCPRange QCPGraph::getValueRange(bool &validRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
02145 {
02146   // just call the specialized version which takes an additional argument whether error bars
02147   // should also be taken into consideration for range calculation. We set this to true here.
02148   return getValueRange(validRange, inSignDomain, true);
02149 }
02150 
02156 QCPRange QCPGraph::getKeyRange(bool &validRange, SignDomain inSignDomain, bool includeErrors) const
02157 {
02158   QCPRange range;
02159   bool haveLower = false;
02160   bool haveUpper = false;
02161   
02162   double current, currentErrorMinus, currentErrorPlus;
02163   
02164   if (inSignDomain == sdBoth) // range may be anywhere
02165   {
02166     QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
02167     while (it != mData->constEnd())
02168     {
02169       current = it.value().key;
02170       currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorMinus : 0);
02171       currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorPlus : 0);
02172       if (current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower)
02173       {
02174         range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
02175         haveLower = true;
02176       }
02177       if (current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper)
02178       {
02179         range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
02180         haveUpper = true;
02181       }
02182       ++it;
02183     }
02184   } else if (inSignDomain == sdNegative) // range may only be in the negative sign domain
02185   {
02186     QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
02187     while (it != mData->constEnd())
02188     {
02189       current = it.value().key;
02190       currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorMinus : 0);
02191       currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorPlus : 0);
02192       if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus < 0)
02193       {
02194         range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
02195         haveLower = true;
02196       }
02197       if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus < 0)
02198       {
02199         range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
02200         haveUpper = true;
02201       }
02202       if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to geht that point.
02203       {
02204         if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current < 0)
02205         {
02206           range.lower = current;
02207           haveLower = true;
02208         }
02209         if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current < 0)
02210         {
02211           range.upper = current;
02212           haveUpper = true;
02213         }
02214       }
02215       ++it;
02216     }
02217   } else if (inSignDomain == sdPositive) // range may only be in the positive sign domain
02218   {
02219     QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
02220     while (it != mData->constEnd())
02221     {
02222       current = it.value().key;
02223       currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorMinus : 0);
02224       currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorPlus : 0);
02225       if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus > 0)
02226       {
02227         range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
02228         haveLower = true;
02229       }
02230       if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus > 0)
02231       {
02232         range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
02233         haveUpper = true;
02234       }
02235       if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to get that point.
02236       {
02237         if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current > 0)
02238         {
02239           range.lower = current;
02240           haveLower = true;
02241         }
02242         if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current > 0)
02243         {
02244           range.upper = current;
02245           haveUpper = true;
02246         }
02247       }
02248       ++it;
02249     }
02250   }
02251   
02252   validRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
02253   return range;
02254 }
02255 
02261 QCPRange QCPGraph::getValueRange(bool &validRange, SignDomain inSignDomain, bool includeErrors) const
02262 {
02263   QCPRange range;
02264   bool haveLower = false;
02265   bool haveUpper = false;
02266   
02267   double current, currentErrorMinus, currentErrorPlus;
02268   
02269   if (inSignDomain == sdBoth) // range may be anywhere
02270   {
02271     QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
02272     while (it != mData->constEnd())
02273     {
02274       current = it.value().value;
02275       currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorMinus : 0);
02276       currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorPlus : 0);
02277       if (current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower)
02278       {
02279         range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
02280         haveLower = true;
02281       }
02282       if (current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper)
02283       {
02284         range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
02285         haveUpper = true;
02286       }
02287       ++it;
02288     }
02289   } else if (inSignDomain == sdNegative) // range may only be in the negative sign domain
02290   {
02291     QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
02292     while (it != mData->constEnd())
02293     {
02294       current = it.value().value;
02295       currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorMinus : 0);
02296       currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorPlus : 0);
02297       if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus < 0)
02298       {
02299         range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
02300         haveLower = true;
02301       }
02302       if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus < 0)
02303       {
02304         range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
02305         haveUpper = true;
02306       }
02307       if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to get that point.
02308       {
02309         if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current < 0)
02310         {
02311           range.lower = current;
02312           haveLower = true;
02313         }
02314         if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current < 0)
02315         {
02316           range.upper = current;
02317           haveUpper = true;
02318         }
02319       }
02320       ++it;
02321     }
02322   } else if (inSignDomain == sdPositive) // range may only be in the positive sign domain
02323   {
02324     QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
02325     while (it != mData->constEnd())
02326     {
02327       current = it.value().value;
02328       currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorMinus : 0);
02329       currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorPlus : 0);
02330       if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus > 0)
02331       {
02332         range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
02333         haveLower = true;
02334       }
02335       if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus > 0)
02336       {
02337         range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
02338         haveUpper = true;
02339       }
02340       if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to geht that point.
02341       {
02342         if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current > 0)
02343         {
02344           range.lower = current;
02345           haveLower = true;
02346         }
02347         if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current > 0)
02348         {
02349           range.upper = current;
02350           haveUpper = true;
02351         }
02352       }
02353       ++it;
02354     }
02355   }
02356   
02357   validRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
02358   return range;
02359 }
02360 
02361 
02362 // ================================================================================
02363 // =================== QCPRange
02364 // ================================================================================
02380 const double QCPRange::minRange = 1e-280;
02381 
02390 const double QCPRange::maxRange = 1e250;
02391 
02395 QCPRange::QCPRange() :
02396   lower(0),
02397   upper(0)
02398 {
02399 }
02400 
02404 QCPRange::QCPRange(double lower, double upper) :
02405   lower(lower),
02406   upper(upper)
02407 {
02408   normalize();
02409 }
02410 
02414 double QCPRange::size() const
02415 {
02416   return upper-lower;
02417 }
02418 
02422 double QCPRange::center() const
02423 {
02424   return (upper+lower)*0.5;
02425 }
02426 
02431 void QCPRange::normalize()
02432 {
02433   if (lower > upper)
02434     qSwap(lower, upper);
02435 }
02436 
02449 QCPRange QCPRange::sanitizedForLogScale() const
02450 {
02451   double rangeFac = 1e-3;
02452   QCPRange sanitizedRange(lower, upper);
02453   sanitizedRange.normalize();
02454   // can't have range spanning negative and positive values in log plot, so change range to fix it
02455   //if (qFuzzyCompare(sanitizedRange.lower+1, 1) && !qFuzzyCompare(sanitizedRange.upper+1, 1))
02456   if (sanitizedRange.lower == 0.0 && sanitizedRange.upper != 0.0)
02457   {
02458     // case lower is 0
02459     if (rangeFac < sanitizedRange.upper*rangeFac)
02460       sanitizedRange.lower = rangeFac;
02461     else
02462       sanitizedRange.lower = sanitizedRange.upper*rangeFac;
02463   } //else if (!qFuzzyCompare(lower+1, 1) && qFuzzyCompare(upper+1, 1))
02464   else if (sanitizedRange.lower != 0.0 && sanitizedRange.upper == 0.0)
02465   {
02466     // case upper is 0
02467     if (-rangeFac > sanitizedRange.lower*rangeFac)
02468       sanitizedRange.upper = -rangeFac;
02469     else
02470       sanitizedRange.upper = sanitizedRange.lower*rangeFac;
02471   } else if (sanitizedRange.lower < 0 && sanitizedRange.upper > 0)
02472   {
02473     // find out whether negative or positive interval is wider to decide which sign domain will be chosen
02474     if (-sanitizedRange.lower > sanitizedRange.upper)
02475     {
02476       // negative is wider, do same as in case upper is 0
02477       if (-rangeFac > sanitizedRange.lower*rangeFac)
02478         sanitizedRange.upper = -rangeFac;
02479       else
02480         sanitizedRange.upper = sanitizedRange.lower*rangeFac;
02481     } else
02482     {
02483       // positive is wider, do same as in case lower is 0
02484       if (rangeFac < sanitizedRange.upper*rangeFac)
02485         sanitizedRange.lower = rangeFac;
02486       else
02487         sanitizedRange.lower = sanitizedRange.upper*rangeFac;
02488     }
02489   }
02490   // due to normalization, case lower>0 && upper<0 should never occur, because that implies upper<lower
02491   return sanitizedRange;
02492 }
02493 
02498 QCPRange QCPRange::sanitizedForLinScale() const
02499 {
02500   QCPRange sanitizedRange(lower, upper);
02501   sanitizedRange.normalize();
02502   return sanitizedRange;
02503 }
02504 
02508 bool QCPRange::contains(double value) const
02509 {
02510   return value >= lower && value <= upper;
02511 }
02512 
02521 bool QCPRange::validRange(double lower, double upper)
02522 {
02523   /*
02524   return (lower > -maxRange &&
02525           upper < maxRange &&
02526           qAbs(lower-upper) > minRange &&
02527           (lower < -minRange || lower > minRange) &&
02528           (upper < -minRange || upper > minRange));
02529           */
02530   return (lower > -maxRange &&
02531           upper < maxRange &&
02532           qAbs(lower-upper) > minRange &&
02533           qAbs(lower-upper) < maxRange);
02534 }
02535 
02545 bool QCPRange::validRange(const QCPRange &range)
02546 {
02547   /*
02548   return (range.lower > -maxRange &&
02549           range.upper < maxRange &&
02550           qAbs(range.lower-range.upper) > minRange &&
02551           qAbs(range.lower-range.upper) < maxRange &&
02552           (range.lower < -minRange || range.lower > minRange) &&
02553           (range.upper < -minRange || range.upper > minRange));
02554           */
02555   return (range.lower > -maxRange &&
02556           range.upper < maxRange &&
02557           qAbs(range.lower-range.upper) > minRange &&
02558           qAbs(range.lower-range.upper) < maxRange);
02559 }
02560 
02561 
02562 // ================================================================================
02563 // =================== QCPLegend
02564 // ================================================================================
02565 
02572 /* start of documentation of signals */
02573 
02581 /* end of documentation of signals */
02582 
02589 QCPLegend::QCPLegend(QCustomPlot *parentPlot) :
02590   QCPLayerable(parentPlot)
02591 {
02592   setAntialiased(false);
02593   setPositionStyle(psTopRight);
02594   setSize(100, 28);
02595   setMinimumSize(100, 0);
02596   setIconSize(32, 18);
02597   setAutoSize(true);
02598   
02599   setMargin(12, 12, 12, 12);
02600   setPadding(8, 8, 3, 3);
02601   setItemSpacing(3);
02602   setIconTextPadding(7);
02603   
02604   setSelectable(spLegendBox | spItems);
02605   setSelected(spNone);
02606   
02607   setBorderPen(QPen(Qt::black));
02608   setSelectedBorderPen(QPen(Qt::blue, 2));
02609   setIconBorderPen(Qt::NoPen);
02610   setSelectedIconBorderPen(QPen(Qt::blue, 2));
02611   setBrush(Qt::white);
02612   setSelectedBrush(Qt::white);
02613   setFont(parentPlot->font());
02614   setSelectedFont(parentPlot->font());
02615   setTextColor(Qt::black);
02616   setSelectedTextColor(Qt::blue);
02617 }
02618 
02619 QCPLegend::~QCPLegend()
02620 {
02621   clearItems();
02622 }
02623

02628 {
02629   mBorderPen = pen;
02630 }
02631

02636 {
02637   mBrush = brush;
02638 }
02639 
02649 void QCPLegend::setFont(const QFont &font)
02650 {
02651   mFont = font;
02652   for (int i=0; i<mItems.size(); ++i)
02653     mItems.at(i)->setFont(mFont);
02654 }
02655

02666 {
02667   mTextColor = color;
02668   for (int i=0; i<mItems.size(); ++i)
02669     mItems.at(i)->setTextColor(color);
02670 }
